q: Last week his legal team called for a re-examination of evidence in his perjury trial in the wake of the resignation of the Prime Minister's head of communications Andy Coulson . One friend said that Sheridan was his usual upbeat self and philosophical about things. There's a lot going on legally and he's preparing his speech for court, but apart from that I think he'll just want to spend some time with the family because they don't know how long it'll be after Wednesday. The friend added:" Obviously the big worry is what the sentence is going to be but he's in fine fettle. He's got a lot to do." Another friend said

turned on to it," said NBA deputy commissioner Russ Granik , who was at Philadelphia's First Union Center on Wednesday night, when Allen Iverson scored 54 points to Chris Paul 's 28 in the 76ers' 97-92 victory. For better or worse, fans like it when you get superstars going against each other. People have been hearing about these guys for years now, but they haven't gotten this far before where they met each other at this level. That gets people interested. With the NBA's overall popularity declining and new rules designed to make the game more appealing set to take effect next season, an Iverson-Carter matchup is what the league really needed." Earlier today, Kara DioGuardi spoke candidly about her experience on the show that thrust the widely unknown songwriter into the blinding spotlight of one of the most successful series in television history. It was a real learning curve for me-- not only was I judging talent on the spot, but I was learning how to be a TV personality, Kara DioGuardi said." Robert Gerald Ford , who produces the show with his wife Michelle, said he wanted Donald Rumsfeld to appear as a witness in a lawsuit, testifying about why aggressive interrogation techniques like water-boarding are sometimes needed during wartime. It's an episode about moral relativism about what is considered torture and what is not, Robert Gerald Ford said. But Keith Urbahn, who works for the former defense secretary, said the idea rules Donald Rumsfeld out." This area is so fraught with legal ramifications," Urbahn said

, as most broadcasters interrupted their coverage of the Iraq inquiry to devote themselves to Mr. Andy Coulson 's drama. While Mr. David Cameron was quick to issue a statement supporting Mr. Andy Coulson Friday, arguing that his ex-aide has been punished twice for the same offence, the tabloid scandal has tainted his government with two less than desirable associations.
